refine.label: Refine
refine.prompt: Refine the target text for clarity, flow, and academic tone. Keep meaning. DO NOT change, remove, reorder, or duplicate any citations/anchors (keep them EXACTLY as-is).

paraphrase.label: Paraphrase
paraphrase.prompt: Paraphrase the target text while preserving meaning and technical accuracy. Keep citations/anchors EXACTLY unchanged and in the same places.

shorten.label: Shorten
shorten.prompt: Shorten the target text (reduce length) while preserving all arguments and key details. Keep citations/anchors EXACTLY unchanged.

substantiate.label: Substantiate
substantiate.prompt: Strengthen the argument by making claims more precise and adding brief clarifying context, without introducing new citations. Keep all existing citations/anchors EXACTLY unchanged.

proofread.label: Proofread
proofread.prompt: Proofread for grammar, punctuation, and style. Keep meaning. Keep citations/anchors EXACTLY unchanged.

abstract.label: Abstract
abstract.prompt: Write the Abstract section for the entire document. Summarize the purpose, method, key findings, and contribution in a single, cohesive paragraph (150–220 words). Return only the paragraph text (no heading label, no bullet list). Use only information from the document. Do NOT invent citations or facts; if you reuse an existing citation, keep its anchor text EXACTLY as in the document.

introduction.label: Introduction
introduction.prompt: Write the Introduction section for the entire document. Provide context, state the problem, clarify the research question or objective, and preview the structure. Return one polished paragraph (180–280 words) with no heading label or bullets. Use only the document's content. Do NOT invent citations or facts; preserve any reused citation anchors EXACTLY.

methodology.label: Methodology
methodology.prompt: Write the Methodology section for the entire document. Describe the research design, data/materials, and analytic approach in one paragraph (180–280 words) with no heading label or bullets. Use only the document's content. Do NOT invent citations or facts; preserve any reused citation anchors EXACTLY.

findings.label: Findings
findings.prompt: Write the Findings section for the entire document. Present the core results/claims clearly and objectively in one paragraph (180–280 words) with no heading label or bullets. Use only evidence from the document. Do NOT invent citations or facts; preserve any reused citation anchors EXACTLY.

recommendations.label: Recommendations
recommendations.prompt: Write the Recommendations section for the entire document. Provide actionable, prioritized recommendations grounded in the document's findings, in one paragraph (180–280 words) with no heading label or bullets. Use only information from the document. Do NOT invent citations or facts; preserve any reused citation anchors EXACTLY.

conclusion.label: Conclusion
conclusion.prompt: Write the Conclusion section for the entire document. Synthesize the main contribution, restate the significance, and close with implications or next steps in one paragraph (150–220 words) with no heading label or bullets. Use only the document's content. Do NOT invent citations or facts; preserve any reused citation anchors EXACTLY.
